name: places/ChIJ989JqtJZwokRqKlQmQpwfk4

adrFormatAddress: 555 W 57th St 6th floor, New York, NY 10019, USA

originalText.text: I had a really good experience with Aura Prep. The training was extensive and prepared me well for the NREMT and the New York DOH exams. Sean is also a fantastic lecturer so the material is easy to retain and the asynchronous learning modules offer excellent supplementary material as well.

text.text: I had a really good experience with Aura Prep. The training was extensive and prepared me well for the NREMT and the New York DOH exams. Sean is also a fantastic lecturer so the material is easy to retain and the asynchronous learning modules offer excellent supplementary material as well.

originalText.text:
Right from the first inquiry call up to my last class it was a great experience. Sean knows his stuff and was somehow able to keep it interesting even after 100+ hours of Zoom classes. Sean is the main guy but a shout out to Nuqui for his help with the study group and Zac for his zen-like practical skills training. In fact, all of the trainers were professional but not dull. You want NYC EMT field stories sprinkled with a sense of humor? It was an eye-opener! Don't fall behind though. There is a lot of material to go over and learning modules and weekly tests. This is NOT a fancy first aid course.

For what I paid I got a lot. The text book alone is over $200 if you buy it online. Yet I never felt like I was getting short-changed because the fee was reasonable.

Finally, I believe this organization has some credibility in the industry. When I was on a ride-a-long in the Bronx I mentioned to one of the EMTs where I was getting my training and she was like "They have a good reputation". Thumbs up from this newly minted EMT!

originalText.text: Couldn't have asked for a better training experience! Sean was absolutely fabulous, and I felt so prepared coming into the in person skills days. Sharkey, Kara, French, and every single other instructor were beyond helpful and I cannot thank them enough for the skills and wisdom they imparted. I can honestly say that I did not have a single instructor who I did not love. I recommend Aura to anyone interested in going into EMS. They are the best of the best!

text.text: Couldn't have asked for a better training experience! Sean was absolutely fabulous, and I felt so prepared coming into the in person skills days. Sharkey, Kara, French, and every single other instructor were beyond helpful and I cannot thank them enough for the skills and wisdom they imparted. I can honestly say that I did not have a single instructor who I did not love. I recommend Aura to anyone interested in going into EMS. They are the best of the best!

originalText.text:
Amazing training experience, great and knowledgeable instructors, both for theory (Sean is amazing, and the pacing of an all-virtual instruction there worked so well) and practical (the pair of medics I got at the Staten Island/Wagner College location, Justine and Vinnie, really got our skills solid).

I passed the NREMT on the first go, so for those who measure success that way, there you are!

Absolutely delighted and highly recommend.

originalText.text: This is the best Suffolk County/ New York State EMT program out there. I did the hybrid program so I participated in Zoom lectures on all the material, followed up by a month and a half of in person skills. Firstly, Sean is the main instructor who runs the lectures and he is amazing. He explains everything in full and always stops when someone has a question or just stops and asks if anyone has any questions. Sean provides you with a schedule on the first day that outlines everything in the course and I can tell you from personal experience that seeing the schedule really helped me a lot in time management and getting everything I needed to get done. Second, the in person skills were amazing. I was out of Ronkonkoma and the instructors there (Rick, Felix, Matt, and Steven) were very helpful and knowledgeable about the skills. The best part about the skills besides the instructors was the size of the class. My class had only 8 people and I heard that previous classes had about 12 or 15. The small size is because the school is spread throughout the state. However, because of the small class size, the instructors could have more 1 on 1 time and explain everything in depth. It's not like a big city program with almost 100 students and 2 instructors. Trying to learn in that environment is a lot harder than in Aura Prep. Lastly, Aura Prep is very good at responding to emails. Anytime I had a question either about the program, material, or something random Sean or whoever I was emailing would get back to me fast and with all my questions answered. This is a very efficient, effective, and affordable course and I highly recommend it for anyone who is looking to become an EMT.
